reviews.title: Truly Dire
reviews.text: As I walked from my car to the drab reception of this hotel I passed a man urinating on the exterior wall. Unfortunately that set the scene for my stay .

reviews.title: Avoid
reviews.text: I had booked a family room wanting to maximise space andthe rooms are cheap, so why not? But I was so glad my family weren't there with me. The room was grubby and the noise! Ithought other reviews on here were exaggerating the noise from the ring road but it was just as described and entirely unremitting. I would have had a better night's sleep if I had pitched a tent on the central reservation of the M4.

reviews.title: Only a place to rest your head don't expect anything else
reviews.text: I immediately went to reception to complain and ask to be moved. Apparently the noise was my fault for having the temerity to book a family room. Silly me! Anyway the hotel was full of unfortunates that night and I couldn't move. I looked longingly at the Penta just over the road then went to buy some earplugs.

reviews.title: what a hovel - AVOID!!
reviews.text: At least I was only there for one night.Had it been any longer i would have been driven insane by sleep deprivation. I can laugh about it now. Ho ho ho!

reviews.title: Avoid this Travelodge at all costs
reviews.text: Oh, and it smells. There's nothing to recommend this hovel. Avoid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights as visiting wifes son and to take in the Regatta at Henley. Only paid £29.00 per night and also pre-booked breakfast.
reviews.title: Well below average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room as expected basic but noisy even with the window closed due to heavy traffic. No air-con so fan used but noisy through the night. Bathroom not cleaned well at all. As for cleaning the room ok on arrival but after that just the basics. On the Sunday must have been in a rush as only bin emptied and towels changed. Breakfast consited of a choice of cereal, tinned fruit, fruit juice, toast, pastry and croissant. Disappointed to say the least.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the price

reviews.text: Parking had to use the nearby multi storey for an overnight cost of £2.00. However you had to get a voucher from reception and then round to pay before 10.00am of it would be £8.00. On street parking limited to 30minutes.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I've ever stayed at, fact.

likes.liked: — Free high-risk parking right outside followed by a nice cup of tea when the kids went to sleep.
likes.disliked: — The whole stay apart from the 2 things listed above.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this place needs a complete overall as it is well below average standard. I would certainly not have paid the full price for this room. Next time we are visiting will certainly be looking elsewhere.
reviews.title: Ok. Typical Travelodge.

reviews.text: Stayed one night in February 2009 having booked in advance at £9 for the room.
reviews.title: Cheap, good location.

likes.liked: — Plenty of space for the price, good location.

reviews.text: The price does not matter, this is not a hotel it is a disgusting homeless people's hostel. It was damp, noisly, the carpets were all taped up, the lift vandalised and TYravelodge didn't even reply to my email complaint. We booked in for 4 nights and stayed 1, no response to my request for a refund. Don't stay here it's is really that bad.
reviews.title: Disgusting Hell hole DSS Hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to book a hotel in Reading quickly as our daughter gave birth early and we needed to visit urgently. Because of that we paid £62.00 for the night (this included continental breakfast for two).
reviews.title: Only stay if you get a really cheap deal

reviews.text: We had a problem finding the entrance to the hotel as our sat nav kept taking us past on the main road next to it, we tried phoning the hotel but no answer despite being charged 10p a minute from a land line and lord knows how much from our mobile!
reviews.title: Only stay if you are a good sleeper

reviews.text: Finally go to the hotel, check in was fine and we were given our extra towel as there were two of us in the room. (think Frank Oz in the Blues Brothers!)
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY.... Better off Staying at the much Plusher Penta Opp for ext £20. THE HOTEL IS DISGUSTING AND MANAGERS LIE
Travelodge , My sweet home in United Kingdom
reviews.text: The room was a reasonable size and clean, the bedding was clean, quite a small TV, not flat screen, but good reception and reasonable choice of stations. Very little hanging or storage space of any kind, these rooms are meant for a quick in and out. The room was quite drab, no frills at all, very basic and funcional, no hairdryer (luckily my husband is bald!)

3 of us stayed here to catch up with friends for shopping and night out in Reading. The location is great, very central and walking distance to all the shops/bars/restaurants and the car park was a 5 minute walk away from the hotel.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: The room itself was so hot and the window is locked which is a bit frustrating. It was also a bit run down but I expected that anyway for paying £35 for the room. The bathroom tap was also stiff and leaky. The TV worked fine, there was tea/coffee provided, the kettle worked and the bed was comfy! There was enough mirror space for 3 girls to get ready too which is a plus.
reviews.title: Not Good

reviews.text: The corridors were a bit smelly but thats probably because of the lack of fresh air going through the hotel.
reviews.title: The worst travelodge I have ever seen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is only 1 main complaint from my friend who slept on the sofa. She woke up with a few bite marks on her body and neck which has been reported to the manager.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book this hotel if you are after somewhere very budget but in a good location. I would probably pay more for somewhere nicer.
reviews.title: Diabolical
